intro: Cryptantha longiflora, commonly known as the long-flower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha longiflora is adapted to arid environments and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
